data.name: Construct the min number with given sum of digits (36-based).
data.description:
A non-negative 36-based integer is consists of digits `0` ~ `9`,`a` ~ `z`.  
Value of each digit is similar as hex number, but extended to `z`:
- `a` -> `10`
- ..
- `f` -> `15`
- ..
- `z` -> `35`

Each digit can be used at most once.

Given sum of each digit of the number as `x`, find the min possible number, represented as string.

e.g
- Given sum `0`, the min number is `"0"`.
- Given sum `1`, the min number is `"1"`.
- Given sum `15`, the min number is `"f"`.
- Given sum `36`, the min number is `"1z"`.
  
Tips:
- The valid input sum is in range `[0, 630]`.
- For invalid input, return `null`.
- Use lower case `a` ~ `z`, not upper case.

More kata in this serial:
- Find the `max` number, which is 10-based.  
  https://www.codewars.com/kata/61a498cf085ad00051190591
